name: Lebanon
description: Lebanon, a small nation situated in the Eastern Mediterranean, boasts a rich and complex history, stunning natural beauty, and a vibrant cultural heritage.  It’s a land of dramatic mountains, ancient forests, and a coastline fringed with turquoise waters. Despite facing significant challenges, Lebanon remains a country of resilience, hospitality, and breathtaking landscapes.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital and economic heart of Lebanon.
quickFacts.detail: Beirut is a city of contrasts, blending ancient ruins with modern architecture and a thriving arts scene.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Lebanon's population is diverse, reflecting its historical influences.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is high, particularly in urban areas like Beirut and Mount Lebanon.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Lebanon is a relatively small country with varied terrain.
quickFacts.detail: It’s bordered by Syria to the east and Israel to the south.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: French and English are also widely spoken, particularly in Beirut.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Lebanese Pound has experienced significant volatility in recent years.

climateData.title: Lebanon's Climate
climateData.description: Lebanon experiences a Mediterranean climate characterized by hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters.  The coastal regions benefit from the tempering influence of the Mediterranean Sea, while the mountainous interior experiences cooler temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Long, hot, and dry summers prevail across the country. Temperatures can soar to 40°C (104°F) or higher, especially inland.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings a welcome shift in weather, with temperatures gradually cooling and rainfall increasing. The landscape transforms into a vibrant tapestry of colors.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are mild and wet, with average temperatures ranging from 5°C to 15°C (41°F to 59°F). Snowfall is common in the mountainous regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring is a beautiful time in Lebanon, with blossoming flowers and pleasant temperatures. Rainfall remains moderate, and the landscape comes alive with greenery.

naturalWonders.name: Qadisha Valley
naturalWonders.description: The Qadisha Valley is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, renowned for its stunning natural beauty and rich religious history. It’s a deep gorge carved by the river Nahr al-Jabal, offering breathtaking views and numerous monasteries.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The valley is a haven for hikers and spiritual seekers alike. The monasteries, built into the cliffsides, are adorned with ancient frescoes and offer a glimpse into Lebanon's past. The area is also home to a diverse range of flora and fauna.

naturalWonders.name: Byblos (Jbeil)
naturalWonders.description: Byblos, one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world, offers a fascinating blend of ancient history and modern charm. Its harbor, surrounded by Phoenician walls, is a picturesque sight.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The city boasts a rich archaeological heritage, including a Roman theater, a Crusader castle, and numerous temples. The Byblos Archaeological Site is a must-see for history buffs and culture enthusiasts. The harbor is a bustling fishing port and a popular spot for seafood restaurants.
viewingTips: Explore the Old City on foot.
Take a boat trip along the harbor.

naturalWonders.name: Shouf Cedar Nature Reserve
naturalWonders.description: The Shouf Cedar Nature Reserve is a protected area dedicated to the preservation of Lebanon’s ancient cedar forests, a symbol of the country’s identity.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This reserve is home to some of the oldest and largest cedar trees in Lebanon, dating back centuries. The area also supports a diverse range of wildlife, including birds, mammals, and reptiles. Hiking trails wind through the forest, offering stunning views and a chance to connect with nature.

ecosystemData.title: Lebanon's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Lebanon’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from Mediterranean coastal habitats to mountainous forests and arid plains.  However, they are increasingly threatened by human activities and climate change.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mediterranean Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: Lebanon’s Mediterranean flora is characterized by drought-resistant shrubs, herbs, and trees adapted to the hot, dry summers.

statistics.details: A significant number of plant species are endemic to Lebanon.
Lebanon is renowned for its olive groves.

notableSpecies.name: Wild Olive (Olea europaea sylvestris)
notableSpecies.significance: A key component of the Lebanese landscape and economy.

notableSpecies.name: Maquis shrubland
notableSpecies.significance: A unique ecosystem adapted to the Mediterranean climate.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mountain Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: The mountainous regions of Lebanon are covered in a mix of coniferous and deciduous forests, providing habitat for a variety of wildlife.

statistics.details: Forest cover is concentrated in the northern and eastern regions.
A vital part of Lebanon's natural heritage.

notableSpecies.name: Cedar (Cedrus libani)
notableSpecies.significance: A national symbol of Lebanon and a globally important tree species.

notableSpecies.name: Oak (Quercus spp.)
notableSpecies.significance: A common tree species in the mountainous regions.
